snippet: While visitors have flocked to the three-wheel vehicle to navigate the hilly city in Portugal, residents fume about pollution, noisier streets and a “quality of living problem.”
abstract: Lisbon Journal; tuk-tuks, miniature motorized three-wheeled vehicles, have taken over Lisbon's streets amid city's push to develop tourist industry; drivers and their fares appreciate vehicle's dexterity in navigating city's labyrinthine streets; officials have begun enacting restrictions to appease residents, who complain about noise and pollution, and taxi drivers, who fear threat to their business.
lead_paragraph: While visitors have flocked to the three-wheel vehicle to navigate the hilly city in Portugal, residents fume about pollution, noisier streets and a “quality of living problem.”

headline.print_headline: Three-Wheeled Outsiders Arrive in Droves and Make Themselves at Home
headline.main: Tuk-Tuks, Three-Wheeled Outsiders, Make Themselves at Home in Lisbon
